intro: Thibaudia portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican thibaudia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
